head.title: Electric Flow integration with CICS CM

div.p: Plugin Version @PLUGIN_VERSION@
Revised on December 13, 2017

This plugin integrates Commander with the CICS Configuration Manager (CM) tool for administering resource definitions in the CICS application server. It provides access to all CICS CM operations via the CICS CM SOAP API.

ul.h2: The EC-CICS-CM Procedures and What They Are Used For
ul.p:
For a CICS CM perspective, see
https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SS2L7A_5.3.0/com.ibm.cics.cm.doc/ccv-api-summary.html
Here are the EC-CICS-CM procedures, grouped according to their purpose:

li.p: Create* Create a resource definition (CreateInOther) or a CICS Configuration Manager repository object ( CreateInRepository).
Update* Modify a resource definition (UpdateInOther) or a CICS Configuration Manager repository object ( UpdateInRepository).

Copy
Copy resource definitions between groups or CICS configurations.
Delete* Delete resource definitions (DeleteFromOther) or CICS Configuration Manager repository objects ( DeleteFromRepository).

Alter
Alter selected attribute values across one or more resource definitions, without affecting other attribute values.
Rename* Rename resource definitions, and optionally move them to another group (RenameResDef, or RenameFromGroup to rename/move the contents of a resource group).
Add* Add objects to a container object, such as a change package ( AddResDefToChgPkg, or AddCmdToChgPkg to add a command), to a resource group (AddToResGrp), or to a list (AddToResDesc).

Remove* Remove objects from a container object, such as a change package (RemoveResDefFromChgPkg, or RemoveCmdToChgPkg to remove a command), from a resource group ( RemoveFromResGrp), or list (RemoveFromResDesc).

Inquire* Return all the fields for a single resource definition ( InquireInOther), CICS Configuration Manager repository object (InquireInRepository), or CICS Configuration Manager journal object (InquireInJournal).

List* Return selected fields from one or more resource definitions ( ListFromOther, or ListWithinResults to filter the results), CICS Configuration Manager repository objects (ListFromRepository), or CICS Configuration Manager journal objects (ListFromJournal).

Ready
Indicate that the resource definitions in a change package are ready for migration.

Unready
Indicate that the resource definitions in a change package are no longer ready for migration.

Approve
Add to a change package the approval of a particular approver role.

Disapprove
Remove from a change package the approval of a particular approver role.

Migrate
Copy the resource definitions in a change package from source to target CICS configurations, and invoke commands in the change package on target CICS configurations, according to the specified migration scheme.

Backout
Back out a previous change package migration.

p.b: Altering in-memory images of resource definitions in active CICS regions:

li.p: Discard* Discard the in-memory image of resource definitions from active CICS regions (DiscardChgPkg, or DiscardAdHoc for arbitrary resource definitions not from a change package).
Install* Dynamically make resource definitions available to an active CICS region (InstallChgPkg, or InstallAdHoc for arbitrary resource definitions not from a change package).

Newcopy* Reload in-memory copies of resource definitions associated with a CICS program definition or document template definition (NewcopyChgPkg, or NewcopyAdHoc for arbitrary resource definitions not from a change package).

p.b: Importing resource definitions from an export file:

li.p:
Import
Import resource definitions from an export file received from another CICS Configuration Manager system. Optionally, if the export file contains change package details, also registers change packages in the importing CICS Configuration Manager repository.

p.b: Recovering historical versions of resource definitions from the journal:

li.p:
Recover
Recovers before or after images of historical resource definitions from the journal.

div.p: Plugin configurations are sets of parameters that apply across some or all of the plugin procedures. They reduce repetition of common values, create predefined parameter sets for end users, and securely store credentials where needed. Each configuration is given a unique name that is entered in designated parameters on procedures that use them.
To create plugin configurations in ElectricFlow, do these steps:

ol.li: Go to Administration > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
Click Configure to open the @PLUGIN_KEY@ Configurations page.
To enable ElectricFlow server to communicate with the API, enter the following information:

tr.td: Unique name for the plugin configuration.
The URL of the SOAP interface of the CICS CM server to connect to (this should normally be of the format http://[server]:[port]/CICS/CWBA/CCVWSDSH/CCVADISP ).
The CICS CM version number (normally the same as the CICS version number).

The EBCDIC code page used by the CICS CM server (currently only the Latin-1-compatible code pages 037 and 1047 are supported -- the distinction between these affects only the characters '[', ']', 'Ý', '¨', '^', and '¬').
The name of the connection from the CSD to a specific CICS region.

div.p: The @PLUGIN_KEY@ Configurations page now shows the new configuration.
To edit plugin configurations in ElectricFlow, do these steps:

ol.li: Go to Administration > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
Click Configure to open the Configurations page.
Find the configuration that you want to edit.
Edit the parameters in the configuration.
Click OK to save the modified configuration.

div.p: Indicate that the resource definitions in a change package are ready for migration.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The change package to mark as being ready to be migrated.
The migration scheme that the change package will be marked as being ready to be migrated with.

div.p: Delete CICS Configuration Manager repository objects

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The location tyoe to delete from: Location Type must be 'Repository' for this procedure (for deleteing from other location types, use the DeleteFromOther procedure instead).
The resource type of the object to delete.
Optional, if it is supplied then the specified object instance and all older instances are deleted, otherwise all versions of the object are deleted.
The name of the object to delete (applies to object types AProfile, CConfig, Exits, Scheme, TFGroup, and TFRule).
The change package ID of the object to delete (applies to object types ChgPkg, CmdAssociation, KeyAssociation, and PScheme).
The CICS Configuration of the object to delete (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The CICS group of the object to delete (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The CICS object type of the object to delete (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The CICS object name of the object to delete (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The scheme of the object to delete (applies to object type PScheme).

The integrity token for the object to delete: used to avoid overwriting changes by other users -- supply the integrity token from an earlier Inquire or Update command for the same object; if the object has changed since the earlier command, then the object will not be deleted (optional, ignored unless the object criteria specifies a single object without masking).

div.p: Return all the fields for a single CICS Configuration Manager journal object.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.

To make the procedure call output an HTML report summarizing the results, supply a list of columns, one per line, in <NAME>=<Header> format, where 'NAME' is the upper-case column name used by the CICS server and 'Header' is the text you want to appear as the column header in the results table.
The type of location to inquire in: the Location Type must be 'Journal' for this procedure (to inquire in other location types, use the InquireInRepository or InquireInOther procedure instead).
The type of the object to inquire the contents of.
The instance of the object to inquire the contents of (to determine the appropriate Object Instance value, first use the ListFromReposiory procedure to list all the instances of the object).

div.p: Indicate that the resource definitions in a change package are no longer ready for migration.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The change package to unmark as being ready to be migrated.
The scheme that the change package will be unmarked as being ready to be migrated with.

div.p: Reload in-memory copies of resource definitions associated with a CICS program definition or document template definition for arbitrary resource definitions not from a change package).

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
Name of location to newcopy in.
Location to newcopy in: must be 'CICS Configuration' for this procedure (to newcopy in other locations, use the NewcopyChgPkg procedure instead).
The object to newcopy's resource type.
The object to newcopy's resource name.
The object to newcopy's resource group.

Any additional objects(s) to newcopy: XML serialized list of sets of MAPDEF/PROGDEF/PRTNDEF/DOCDEF object criteria, one per additional object, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the object specified above is appended to this).
Whether to do a phase-in action instead of a newcopy, to cater for in-use programs. For details, see the CICS documentation.

The Qualification Data is optional data passed through the Newcopy operations qualification exit point. The needs of your organization determine whether you use an exit program and what processing it performs.

The CSD-based CICS regions on which to perform the newcopy or phasein. 'All': performs the action via all of the remote system connections defined in the CICS configuration (default), 'Local': performs the action on the CICS region that is running the CICS Configuration Manager server (Location Name mustspecify a CICS configuration that refers to the CSD file used by the CICS Configuration Manager server), 'Named': Performs the action via the remote system connections named in Connection Names.
Whitespace-separated list of remote system connection names -- this is ignored unless Connections is set to 'Named'.
If the change package contains candidates for migration to context-based CICS configurations, Target Scope is required.

div.p: Add command to a Change Package.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The type of location to add to: must be 'Repository' for this procedure (to add to other locations, use the approriate other Add... procedure instead).
The CICS configuration associated with the commands that you want to add to the change package.
The command name of the command to add.
The resource type of the resource acted on by the command to add.
The resource name of the resource acted on by the command to add.
The resource group of the resource acted on by the command to add (required unless the resource is located in a Context, for a Context you can specify either this or Object Definition Version).
The resource definition version of the resource acted on by the command to add (omit unless the resource is located in a Context, for a Context you can specify either this or Object Group).
Relevant only when packaging an Add command: it identifies the ResGroup to which you want the resource definitions added.

Additional command(s) to add: an XML serialized list of sets of command object criteria, one per additional command, created using the procedure SerializeCommandObjectCriteria (optional, the command specified above is appended to this).
The ID of the change package to add the command(s) to.
The container type to add the command(s) to: must be 'Change Package' for this procedure (to add to other container types, use the appropriate other Add... procedure instead).

div.p: Dynamically make resource definitions available to an active CICS region.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.

CSD-based CICS Configurations only: specifies whether to set each resource to a (resource-type-dependent) status that allows its definition to be installed (for example, disabled, closed, or out of service), before attempting to install to it. If you do not specify this "quiesce" option, and a resource is in a status that does not allow the install action, then the install action for that resource definition will fail

Qualification Data is optional data passed through the Install operation's qualification exit point. The needs of your organization determine whether you use an exit program and what processing it performs
Whether to discard the resource definition before attempting to install it
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Required for Context-based CICS configurations, ommit for CDS-based CICS configurations.
Filter to select resource definitions of a particular type, excluding any other types of resource definition in the ResGroup, applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations.

div.p: Reload in-memory copies of resource definitions associated with a CICS program definition or document template definition

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
Whether to do a phase-in action instead of a newcopy, to cater for in-use programs. For details, see the CICS documentation.

The Qualification Data is optional data passed through the Newcopy operations qualification exit point. The needs of your organization determine whether you use an exit program and what processing it performs.
If the change package contains candidates for migration to context-based CICS configurations, Target Scope is required.

div.p: Modify a CICS Configuration Manager repository object.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The type of location to update in: for this procedure, this must be 'Repository' (to update in another location type, use theprocedure UpdateInOther instead).
The type of object to update.
The object to update's name (applies to object types AProfile, CConfig, Exits, Scheme, TFGroup, and TFRule).
The object to update's change package ID (applies to object types ChgPkg, CmdAssociation, KeyAssociation, and PScheme).
The object to update's CICS Configuration (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The object to update's CICS group (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The object to update's CICS object type (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The object to update's CICS object name (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The object to update's scheme (applies to object type PScheme).

Th object integrity token of the object to update: used to avoid overwriting changes by other users -- supply the integrity token from an earlier Inquire or Update command for the same object; if the resource has changed since the earlier command, then the object will not be updated (optional).

Name-value pairs to set in the object being updated, one per line in NAME=VALUE format. (For some objects types, some VALUEs may need to be XML datastructures - usually a list of elements preceeded by a count.)

div.p: Return selected fields from one or more resource definitions.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.

To make the procedure call output an HTML report summarizing the results, supply a list of columns, one per line, in <NAME>=<Header> format, where 'NAME' is the upper-case column name used by the CICS server and 'Header' is the text you want to appear as the column header in the results table.
The type of location to list from (to list from a Journal use the procedure ListFromJournal, to list from a Reposititory use the procedure ListFromRepository instead).
The name of the location to list from.
The type of resource to list.
The name of the resource to list (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).

The resource group to list the resource from (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used; required except for the resource types 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' and 'ResDesc (List for CSD)', which cannot be in a resource group, or omit if a Resource Definition Version is supplied).
The resource definition version number of the resource to list (optional, can be specified instead of Resource Group if the Location Type is Context).

(Optional) restriction criteria, whitespace separated in <NAME>.<COMPARATOR>.<VALUE> format. Valid <COMPARATOR> values are EQ, NE, LT, GT, LE, and GE. Restriction criteria all on a single line are combined using logical AND. Groups of restriction critera on different lines are combined using logical OR. For example, to limit the list to resource definitions that were changed after 26 June 2004, specify ChangeTime.GT.2004/06/26 (fields mentioned in restriction criteria will be returned in the listing even if they otherwise would not be).
Specifies whether all attributes of the requested resource definitions are returned or only a default subset (optional, defaults to 'NO').

Specifies whether or not the List command response contains a 'HashingValue' element with a checksum for each selected object, and which fields it uses to calculate the checksum (optional, defaults to 'None').
Specifies whether include various count values in the response (optional, defaults to not including them).

If set, limits the objects returned by List to those changed on or before the specified date and time. You can use this instead of, or in addition to, restriction criteria for change time. Format: yyyy/mm/dd.hh:mm (optional)

If set, sets an upper limit on the number of resource definitions that can be returned by ListFromJournal. If the number of resource definitions that match the specifications of the List command exceeds this limit, then the List command returns an error, with no resource definitions. This avoids the problems associated with returning a subset of objects that match the specifications: for example, depending on how a client sorts the results of the List command, omissions might not be apparent to the end user. (optional)
If set, limits the resource definitions returned by ListFromOther according to one of the selected option (optional, defaults to 'All').

div.p: Return selected fields for CICS Configuration Manager repository object.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.

To make the procedure call output an HTML report summarizing the results, supply a list of columns, one per line, in <NAME>=<Header> format, where 'NAME' is the upper-case column name used by the CICS server and 'Header' is the text you want to appear as the column header in the results table.
Location to list from: location type must be 'Repository' for this procedure (to list from other location types, use the ListFromJournal or ListFromOther procedure instead).
The type of object(s) to list.
The name of the object(s) to list (applies to object types AProfile, CConfig, Exits, Scheme, TFGroup, and TFRule; a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The change package ID of the object(s) to list (applies to object types ChgPkg, CmdAssociation, KeyAssociation, PScheme, and ReadyLst; a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The CICS Configuration of the object(s) to list (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation; a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The CICS group for the object(s) to list (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation; a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The CICS object type for the object(s) to list (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation; a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The CICS object name for the object(s) to list (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation; a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The scheme of the object(s) to list (applies to object types PScheme, Scheme and ReadyLst; a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).

(Optional) restriction criteria, whitespace separated in <NAME>.<COMPARATOR>.<VALUE> format. Valid <COMPARATOR> values are EQ, NE, LT, GT, LE, and GE. Restriction criteria all on a single line are combined using logical AND. Groups of restriction critera on different lines are combined using logical OR. For example, to limit the list to resource definitions that were changed after 26 June 2004, specify ChangeTime.GT.2004/06/26 (fields mentioned in restriction criteria will be returned in the listing even if they otherwise would not be).

Specifies whether or not the List command response contains a 'HashingValue' element with a checksum for each selected object, and which fields it uses to calculate the checksum (optional, defaults to 'None').
Specifies whether to return all versions of an object from the repository, or only the current version (optional, defaults to 'No').

CPIDFormula is relevant only when listing change packages ('APPROVE?': Limits the list to change packages that are ready, and that require approval for a particular migration scheme. 'MIGRATE?': Limits the list to change packages that require migration. These are change packages that are ready and approved (if necessary), and either have not yet been migrated or have been backed out from a previous migration.)
Specifies whether include various count values in the response (optional, defaults to not including them).

If set, limits the objects returned by List to those changed on or before the specified date and time. You can use this instead of, or in addition to, restriction criteria for change time. Format: yyyy/mm/dd.hh:mm (optional)

If set, sets an upper limit on the number of resource definitions that can be returned by ListFromJournal. If the number of resource definitions that match the specifications of the List command exceeds this limit, then the List command returns an error, with no resource definitions. This avoids the problems associated with returning a subset of objects that match the specifications: for example, depending on how a client sorts the results of the List command, omissions might not be apparent to the end user. (optional)

div.p: Modify a resource definition.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of the location to update in.
The type of location to update in (to update in the Repository, use procedure UpdateInRepository instead).
The type of resource to update.
The name of the resource to update.

The resource group to update the resource in (required except for the resource types 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' and 'ResDesc (List for CSD)', which cannot be in a resource group, or omit if a Resource Definition Version is supplied).
The resource definition version number of the resource to update (optional, can be specified instead of Resource Group if the Location Type is Context).

The object integrity token of the resource being updated: used to avoid overwriting changes by other users -- supply the integrity token from an earlier Inquire or Update command for the same object; if the resource has changed since the earlier command, then the object will not be updated (optional).
Applies only to CSysDef objects and is optional.
Name-value pairs to set in the resource definition being updated, one per line in NAME=VALUE format.

div.p: Return all the fields for a single CICS Configuration Manager repository object.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.

To make the procedure call output an HTML report summarizing the results, supply a list of columns, one per line, in <NAME>=<Header> format, where 'NAME' is the upper-case column name used by the CICS server and 'Header' is the text you want to appear as the column header in the results table.
The type of location to inquire in: the Location Type must be 'Repository' for this procedure (to inquire in other location types, use the InquireInJournal or InquireInOther procedure instead)
The type of the object to inquire the contents of.
The name of the object to inquire the contents of (applies to object types AProfile, CConfig, Exits, Scheme, TFGroup, and TFRule).
The change package ID of the object to inquire the contents of (applies to object types ChgPkg, CmdAssociation, KeyAssociation, PScheme, and ReadyLst).
The CICS Configuration of the object to inquire the contents of (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The CICS group for the object to inquire the contents of (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The CICS object type for the object to inquire the contents of (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The CICS object name for the object to inquire the contents of (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The scheme of the object to inquire the contents of (applies to object types PScheme, Scheme and ReadyLst).
The instance of the object to inquire the contents of (optional, if it is omitted the contents of the latest instance will be returned).

div.p: Remove objects from a Change Package.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
Location type to remove from: must be 'Repository' for this procedure (to remove from another location type, use the appropriate other Remove... procedure instead)
The CICS configuration that contains the resource definitions that you want to add to the change package
The resource type of the resource definition to remove.
The resource name of the resource definition to remove.
The resource group of the resource definition to remove.

Additional resource definition(s) to remove: an XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per additional resource definition, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource definition specified above is appended to this).
The ID of the change package to remove the resource definition(s) from.
Container type to remove the resource definition(s) from: must be 'Change Package' for this procedure (to remove from another container type, use the appropriate other Remove... procedure instead)

div.p: Create a CICS Configuration Manager repository object.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
Location to create in (for this procedure this must be 'Repository', to create in other locations use procedure CreateInOther instead).
The resource type of object to create.
The object to create's name (applies to object types AProfile, CConfig, Exits, Scheme, TFGroup, and TFRule).
The object to create's change package ID (applies to object types ChgPkg, CmdAssociation, KeyAssociation, and PScheme).
The object to create's CICS Configuration (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The object to create's CICS group (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The object to create's CICS object type (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The object to create's CICS object name (applies to object types CmdAssociation and KeyAssociation).
The object to create's scheme (applies to object type PScheme).

Name-value pairs to set in the object being created, one per line in NAME=VALUE format. (For some objects types, some VALUEs may need to be XML datastructures - usually a list of elements preceeded by a count.)

div.p: Discard the in-memory image of resource definitions from active CICS regions for arbitrary resource definitions not from a change package.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of the location to discard from.
The type of location to discard from: must be 'CICS Configuration for this procedure (to dicasrd from other location types, use procedure DiscardChgPkg instead).
The type of the object to insdiscard (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The resource name of the resource to discard (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The resource name of the resource to discard (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).

Additional resource(s) to discard: an XML serialized list of sets of MAPDEF/PROGDEF/PRTNDEF/DOCDEF object criteria, one per additional resource, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource specified above is appended to this).

This specifies whether or not to set the resource to a status that allows its definition to be discarded (for example, disabled, closed, or out of service), prior to attempting the action. The status depends on the resource type. If you do not specify this "quiesce" option, and a resource is in a status that does not allow the discard action, then the discard action for that resource definition will fail.

Qualification Data is optional data passed through the Discard operation's qualification exit point. The needs of your organization determine whether you use an exit program and what processing it performs

The CSD-based CICS regions on which to perform the discard. 'All': performs the discard via all of the remote system connections defined in the CICS configuration (default), 'Local': performs the discard on the CICS region that is running the CICS Configuration Manager server (Location Name mustspecify a CICS configuration that refers to the CSD file used by the CICS Configuration Manager server, 'Named': Performs the discard via the remote system connections named in Connection Names.
Whitespace-separated list of remote system connection names -- this is ignored unless Connections is set to 'Named'.
If the list of resources contains candidates for migration to context-based CICS configurations, Target Scope is required.

div.p: Create a resource definition.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of the location to create in.
The type of location to create in (to create in the Repository, use procedure CreateInRepository instead).
The type of resource to create.
The name for the resource to create.
The resource group to create the resource in (required except for the resource types 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' and 'ResDesc (List for CSD)', which cannot be in a resource group).
Name-value pairs to set in the resource definition being created, one per line in NAME=VALUE format.
Optional, applies only to CSysDef objects.
Optional, applies only to CSGLCGCS objects.
Optional, applies only to CSGLCGCS objects.
Optional, applies only to CSGLCGCS objects.
Optional, applies only to LNKSWSCG objects.

div.p: Remove objects from a resource group.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of the location in which to remove from a resource group.
The type of the location in which to remove from a resource group.
Resource type of the resource definition to remove.
Resource name of the resource definition to remove.
The resource group of the resource definition to remove (required unless the resource definition is located in a Context, for a Context you can specify either this or Object Definition Version).

Additional resource definition(s) to remove: an XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per additional resource definition, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource definition specified above is appended to this).
The name of the resource group to remove the resource definition(s) from.

The container type to remove the resource definition(s) from: must be 'Resource Group' for this procedure (to remove from another container type, use the appropriate other Remove... procedure instead).

div.p: Add Resource Definition to a Change Package.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
Location type to add to: must be 'Repository' for this procedure (to add to another location type, use the appropriate other Add... procedure instead)
The CICS configuration that contains the resource definitions that you want to add to the change package
The resource type of the resource definition to add.
The resource name of the resource definition to add.
The resource group of the resource definition to add.

Additional resource definition(s) to add: an XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per additional resource definition, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource definition specified above is appended to this).
The ID of the change package to add the resource definition(s) to.
Container type to add the resource definition(s) to: must be 'Change Package' for this procedure (to add to another container type, use the appropriate other Add... procedure instead)

div.p: Remove from a change package the approval of a particular approver role.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
Withdraw the approval of the migration of this change package.
Withdraw the approval for the migration of the above change package using this migration scheme.
The approver role to remove the approve from.

div.p: Remove from a change package the approval of a particular approver role.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
Approve the migration of this change package.
Approve the migration of the above change package using this migration scheme.
The approver role to approve as.

div.p: Return selected fields from one or more resource definitions with filtering the results.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.

To make the procedure call output an HTML report summarizing the results, supply a list of columns, one per line, in <NAME>=<Header> format, where 'NAME' is the upper-case column name used by the CICS server and 'Header' is the text you want to appear as the column header in the results table.
The type of location to list from (to list from a Journal use the procedure ListFromJournal, to list from a Reposititory use the procedure ListFromRepository instead).
The name of the location to list from.
The type of resource to list.
The name of the resource to list within (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).

The resource group to list within the resource from (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used; required except for the resource types 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' and 'ResDesc (List for CSD)', which cannot be in a resource group, or omit if a Resource Definition Version is supplied).
The resource definition version number of the resource to list within (optional, can be specified instead of Resource Group if the Location Type is Context).

Additional resource(s) to list within: an XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per additional resource to list within, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource specified above is appended to this).

(Optional) restriction criteria, whitespace separated in <NAME>.<COMPARATOR>.<VALUE> format. Valid <COMPARATOR> values are EQ, NE, LT, GT, LE, and GE. Restriction criteria all on a single line are combined using logical AND. Groups of restriction critera on different lines are combined using logical OR. For example, to limit the list to resource definitions that were changed after 26 June 2004, specify ChangeTime.GT.2004/06/26 (fields mentioned in restriction criteria will be returned in the listing even if they otherwise would not be).

div.p: Alter selected attribute values across one or more resource definitions, without affecting other attribute values.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of the location to alter in.
The type of location to alter in.
The type of resource definition(s) to alter.
The name of the resource definition(s) to alter (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The resource group of the resource definition(s) to alter (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).

Additional resource definition(s) to alter: XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per additional resource definition, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource definition specified above is appended to this; however, if the Object Type above is '*' or 'All', or if a masked value was used for Object Name or Object Group then the Serialized Resource Object Criteria must be empty).
Name-value pairs to set in the resource definition(s), one per line in NAME=VALUE format.

div.p: Copy the resource definitions in a change package from source to target CICS configurations, and invoke commands in the change package on target CICS configurations, according to the specified migration scheme.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The migration scheme decribing where and how to migrate the change package.

div.p: Rename/move the contents of a resource group.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The location name to rename in.
The location type to rename in
The type of the resource to rename/move: must be 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' for this procedure (to rename other resource types use the RenameResDef procdure).
The name of the resource group to move resources from.
The name of the resource(s) to move (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The type of the resource(s) to move ('*' or 'All' are allowed).
The name of the resource group to move resources to.
Whether to overwrite existing resource definitions at the target location.

div.p: Remove objects from a list.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of the location in which to remove resource group(s) from a resource description.
The type of the location in which to remove resource group(s) from a resource description.
Resource type to add: must be 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' for this procedure (to add another type of resource to another container type, use the approriate other Add... procedure instead).
The name of the resource group to remove.

Additional resource groups to remove: an XML serialized list of sets of resource group object criteria, one per additional resource group, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource group specified above is appended to this).
The name of the resource description to remove the resource group(s) from.
Container type to remove the resource group(s) from: must be 'Resource Description' for this procedure (to remove from another container type, use the appropriate other Remove... procedure instead).

div.p: Rename resource definitions, and optionally move them to another group.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of the location to rename in.
The type of location to rename in.
The type of the resource to rename/move.
The current name of the resource to rename/move (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The current resource group of the resource to rename/move (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).

Additional resources to rename: an XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per additional object, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the object specified above is appended to this).
The name to rename the resource to.
The resource group to move the resource to.
Additional Name/group pairs to rename/move additional resources to, one per line in NAME/GROUP format, with order matching the Serialized Resource Object Criteria.
Whether to overwrite existing resource definitions at the target location.

div.p: Add objects to a resource group.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of the location in which to add to a resource group.
The type of the location in which to add to a resource group.
Resource type of the resource definition to add.
Resource name of the resource definition to add.
The resource group of the resource definition to add (required unless the resource definition is located in a Context, for a Context you can specify either this or Object Definition Version).
The resource definition version of the resource definition to add (omit unless the resource is located in a Context, for a Context you can specify either this or Object Group).

Additional resource definition(s) to add: an XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per additional resource definition, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource definition specified above is appended to this).
The name of the resource group to add the resource definition(s) to.
The container type to add the resource definition(s) to: must be 'Resource Group' for this procedure (to add to another container type, use the appropriate other Add... procedure instead).

div.p: Dynamically make resource definitions available to an active CICS region for arbitrary resource definitions not from a change package.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The configuration name, CSD location, or CICSPlex Context, depending on Location Type value.
Location to install in (for this procedure this must be 'CICS Configuration')
The name of the object to install (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The type of the object to install (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).
The resource group of the object to install (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).

Additional objects(s) to install: XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per object, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the object specified above is appended to this).

CSD-based CICS Configurations only: specifies whether to set each resource to a (resource-type-dependent) status that allows its definition to be installed (for example, disabled, closed, or out of service), before attempting to install to it. If you do not specify this "quiesce" option, and a resource is in a status that does not allow the install action, then the install action for that resource definition will fail.

Qualification Data is optional data passed through the Install operations qualification exit point. The needs of your organization determine whether you use an exit program and what processing it performs
Whether to discard the resource definition before attempting to install it

The CSD-based CICS regions on which to perform the install. 'All': performs the install via all of the remote system connections defined in the CICS configuration (default), 'Local': performs the install on the CICS region that is running the CICS Configuration Manager server (Location Name mustspecify a CICS configuration that refers to the CSD file used by the CICS Configuration Manager server), 'Named': Performs the install via the remote system connections named in Connection Names.
Whitespace-separated list of remote system connection names -- this is ignored unless Connections is set to 'Named'.
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Required for Context-based CICS configurations, ommit for CDS-based CICS configurations
Filter to select resource definitions of a particular type, excluding any other types of resource definition in the ResGroup, applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations
Applies only to Context-based CICS configurations

div.p: Delete resource definitions.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of location to delete from.
The type of location to delete from (to delete from the Repository, use the procedure DeleteFromRepository instead).
The type of resource to delete.
The name of the resource to delete (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used).

The resource group to delete the resource from (a 'masked' value ending in the wildcard * can be used; required except for the resource types 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' and 'ResDesc (List for CSD)', which cannot be in a resource group, or omit if a Resource Definition Version is supplied).
The resource definition version number of the resource to delete (optional, can be specified instead of Resource Group if the Location Type is Context).

Additional resource(s) to delete: an XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per additional resource to delete, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource specified above is appended to this; however, if the Resource Type above is '*' or 'All', or if a masked value was used for Resource Name or Resource Group then the Serialized Resource Object Criteria must be empty).

The object integrity token of the resource to delete: used to avoid overwriting changes by other users -- supply the integrity token from an earlier Inquire or Update command for the same object; if the resource has changed since the earlier command, then the object will not be deleted (optional, ignored if more than one resource is specified or wildcard masking is used for objects).
Optional, applies only to CSGLCGCS objects.
Optional, applies only to CSGLCGCS objects.
Optional, applies only to CSGLCGCS objects.
Optional, applies only to LNKSWSCG objects.

div.p: Return all the fields for a single resource definition.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.

To make the procedure call output an HTML report summarizing the results, supply a list of columns, one per line, in <NAME>=<Header> format, where 'NAME' is the upper-case column name used by the CICS server and 'Header' is the text you want to appear as the column header in the results table.
The name of the location to inquire in.
The type of location to inquire in (to inquire in other location types, use the InquireInRepository or InquireInJournal procedure instead)
The type of the resource to inquire the contents of.
The name of the resource to inquire the contents of.

The resource group of the resource to inquire the contents of (required except for the resource types 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' and 'ResDesc (List for CSD)', which cannot be in a resource group, or omit if a Resource Definition Version is supplied).
The resource definition version number of the resource to inquire the contents of (optional, can be specified instead of Resource Group if the Location Type is Context).

div.p: Add objects to a list.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The name of the location in which to add resource group(s) to a resource description.
The type of the location in which to add resource group(s) to a resource description.
Resource type to add: must be 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' for this procedure (to add another type of resource to another container type, use the approriate other Add... procedure instead).
The name of the resource group to add.

Additional resource groups to add: an XML serialized list of sets of resource group object criteria, one per additional resource group, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the resource group specified above is appended to this).
The name of the resource description to add the resource group(s) to.
Container type to add the resource group(s) to: must be 'ResDesc (List for CSD)' for this procedure (to add to another container type, use the appropriate other Add... procedure instead).

div.p: Back out a previous change package migration.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The change package ID of the change to back out.
The migration scheme of the change to back out.

The eventID of the execution of the Migrate command for the specified change package and migration scheme to back out (if omitted, it defaults to the most recent Migrate command for that change package and migration scheme).

div.p: Copy resource definitions between groups or CICS configurations.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The location name of source(s) to copy from.
The location type of source(s) to copy from.
The resource type of the source object to copy.
The resource name of the source object to copy.
The resource group of the source object to copy.

Additional source object(s) to copy: XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per source object, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the source object specified above is appended to this).
The location name of the destination to copy to.
The location type of the destination to copy to.
If specified, this identifies the group name that is assigned to the resource definition at the target location (optional unless source and target location names and types are the same).
Whether to overwrite existing resource definitions at the target location.

div.p: Return selected fields from one or more CICS Configuration Manager journal objects.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.

To make the procedure call output an HTML report summarizing the results, supply a list of columns, one per line, in <NAME>=<Header> format, where 'NAME' is the upper-case column name used by the CICS server and 'Header' is the text you want to appear as the column header in the results table.
The type of location to list from: location type must be 'Journal' for this procedure (to list from other location types, use the ListFromRepository or ListFromOther procedure instead).
The journal record CCV release (optional, 3 digits identifying the CICS Configuration Manager product version, release, and modification number).
The journal record CICS release (optional, 3 digits identifying the CICS product version, release, and modification number).
The journal record change package ID (optional).
The journal record CSD dataset name (optional, fully qualified data set name of a CICS system definition file with no enclosing quotes).

If you have specified some journal criteria above, this is an optional resource type for a resource definition embedded in a BAImage, otherwise it is required and specifies the type journal object(s) to list, and must be 'EventStart', 'BAImage', 'EventData' or 'EventEnd'.
If you have specified some journal criteria above, this is an optional resource name for a resource definition embedded in a BAImage (masked values may be used), otherwise it must be omitted.
If you have specified some journal criteria above, this is an optional resource group for a resource definition embedded in a BAImage (masked values may be used), otherwise it must be omitted.

If you have specified some journal criteria above, this is an optional resource definition version for a resource definition embedded in a BAImage (masked values may be used), otherwise it must be omitted.

(Optional) restriction criteria, whitespace separated in <NAME>.<COMPARATOR>.<VALUE> format. Valid <COMPARATOR> values are EQ, NE, LT, GT, LE, and GE. Restriction criteria all on a single line are combined using logical AND. Groups of restriction critera on different lines are combined using logical OR. When listing BAImage journal records, you must prefix the field names of the embedded resource definitions with B_ for before or A_ for after images. For eaxmple, to limit the list to journal records whose before resource definition was changed after 26 June 2004, specify B_ChangeTime.GT.2004/06/26 (fields mentioned in restriction criteria will be returned in the listing even if they otherwise would not be).
Specifies whether all attributes of the requested resource definitions are returned or only a default subset (optional, defaults to 'NO').

Specifies whether or not the List command response contains a 'HashingValue' element with a checksum for each selected object, and which fields it uses to calculate the checksum (optional, defaults to 'None').
Specifies whether include various count values in the response (optional, defaults to not including them).

If set, limits the objects returned by List to those changed on or before the specified date and time. You can use this instead of, or in addition to, restriction criteria for change time. Format: yyyy/mm/dd.hh:mm (optional)

If set, sets an upper limit on the number of resource definitions that can be returned by ListFromJournal. If the number of resource definitions that match the specifications of the List command exceeds this limit, then the List command returns an error, with no resource definitions. This avoids the problems associated with returning a subset of objects that match the specifications: for example, depending on how a client sorts the results of the List command, omissions might not be apparent to the end user. (optional)

div.p: Discard the in-memory image of resource definitions from active CICS regions.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.

This specifies whether or not to set the resource to a status that allows its definition to be discarded (for example, disabled, closed, or out of service), prior to attempting the action. The status depends on the resource type. If you do not specify this "quiesce" option, and a resource is in a status that does not allow the discard action, then the discard action for that resource definition will fail.

Qualification Data is optional data passed through the Discard operation's qualification exit point. The needs of your organization determine whether you use an exit program and what processing it performs.
If the change package contains candidates for migration to context-based CICS configurations, Target Scope is required.

div.p: Import resource definitions from an export file received from another CICS Configuration Manager system. Optionally, if the export file contains change package details, also registers change packages in the importing CICS Configuration Manager repository.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The CICS Configuration Manager export file to import from

Specify either: 'Selection Criteria' to select resource definitions to import based on which change packages they belong to, or 'Object Criteria' to select resource definitions to import based on filter criteria for resource name, group, and type. To import all resource definitions in the export file, specify an asterisk (*) for name, group, and type.
Location to import from: must be 'CICS Configuration'
Change package to import (optional, specify either this or Resource Name, Resource Type, and Resource Group)
Change package to import (optional, may be specified along with a CPID to select a particular migration for the specified chnage pacakage if it was migrated to the export file more than once)
Resource definition to import: resource name (optional, specify either this plus Resource Type and Resource Group, or CPID)
Resource definition to import: resource type (optional, specify either this plus Resource Name and Resource Group, or CPID)
Resource definition to import: resource group (optional, specify either this plus Resource Name and Resource Type, or CPID)
If importing a change package, should it be registered in the repository?

div.p: Remove objects from a Change Package.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The type of location to remove from: must be 'Repository' for this procedure (to remove from other locations, use the approriate other Remove... procedure instead).
The CICS Configuration associated with the commands that you want to remove from the change package
The command name of the command to remove.
The resource type of the resource acted on by the command to remove.
The resource name of the resource acted on by the command to remove.
The resource group of the resource acted on by the command to remove (required unless the resource is located in a Context, for a Context you can specify either this or Object Definition Version).
The resource definition version of the resource acted on by the command to remove (omit unless the resource is located in a Context, for a Context you can specify either this or Object Group).
Relevant only when removing an Add command: it identifies the ResGroup to which you no longer want the resource definitions added.

Additional command(s) to remove: an XML serialized list of sets of command object criteria, one per additional command, created using the procedure SerializeCommandObjectCriteria (optional, the command specified above is appended to this).
The ID of the change package to remove the command(s) from.
The container type to remove the command(s) from: must be 'Change Package' for this procedure (to remove from other container types, use the appropriate other Remove... procedure instead).

div.p: Recovers before or after images of historical resource definitions from the journal.

tr.td: The property sheet or property that results will be returned into.
The type of location to recover from: this must be 'Journal'.
The resource name of the resource definition to recover.
The resource group of the resource definition to recover (this is required unless recovering a 'ResGroup (Group for CSD)' or 'ResDesc (List for CSD)', when it should be omitted).
The resource type of the resource definition to recover.
The resource instance of the resource definition to recover.

Additional objects(s) to recover: XML serialized list of sets of resource object criteria, one per additional object, created using the procedure SerializeOtherObjectCriteria (optional, the object specified above is appended to this).
Specify whether to recover the before image (undo the change) or the after image (redo the change).

The rollback option applies only when recovering before images. The rollback option protects you from unintentionally overwriting changes that are outside of the set you have selected. Specifically, the rollback option ensures that the selected changes for a resource definition form an unbroken chain that begins at the current resource definition and ends at the before image of the oldest selected change.
